keyword: how many calories in a white slice of bread
title: How Many Calories in a White Slice of Bread?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a white slice of bread, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per slice for easy tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a White Slice of Bread?
assumptions: Standard commercial white sandwich bread slice, approximately 28 g, untoasted, no toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, slice thickness, ingredients, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical white slice of bread contains about 79 calories and 15 g of carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a white slice of bread?
faqs.a: Approximately 79 calories per standard 28 g slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in one slice of white bread?
faqs.a: About 15 g of carbohydrates, including 0.7 g fiber and 1.8 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is white bread high in protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low in both: 2.7 g protein and 1 g total fat per slice.

faqs.q: How does toasting affect calories in white bread?
faqs.a: Toasting doesn't change calories, but added spreads like butter do.

faqs.q: Why does sodium vary in white bread slices?
faqs.a: Due to brand recipes and added salt; ranges from 100-200 mg per slice.
